meanings.definition: Of the best quality or highest rank
meanings.sent1: The cake was primo, with the perfect blend of flavors.
meanings.sent2: She always chooses primo ingredients for her recipes.
meanings.sent3: The primo view from the top of the mountain took their breath away.
meanings.sent4: His primo skills on the basketball court made him stand out from the rest.
meanings.sent5: The primo sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: A first-rate or top-quality item or person
meanings.sent1: The restaurant is known for its primo steaks that melt in your mouth.
meanings.sent2: He is considered the primo candidate for the job due to his experience.
meanings.sent3: The detective's primo instincts helped solve the mystery in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork is a primo example of creativity and talent.
meanings.sent5: The primo performance received a standing ovation from the audience.

meanings.sent1: My primo is like a sibling to me, always there when I need support.
meanings.sent2: We grew up together, and my primo has been my closest friend since childhood.
meanings.sent3: At family gatherings, my primo and I always team up for games and fun.
meanings.sent4: My primo shares my love for adventure and trying new things.
meanings.sent5: I can always count on my primo for a good laugh and great company.

meanings.definition: The first or leading part in a musical composition
meanings.sent1: The pianist played the primo part of the concerto with grace and precision.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra conductor emphasized the importance of the primo section in the symphony.
meanings.sent3: During the rehearsal, the musicians focused on perfecting the primo segment of the piece.
meanings.sent4: The composer's attention to detail in the primo melody set the tone for the entire composition.
meanings.sent5: The audience was captivated by the beauty of the primo notes played by the violinist.
